title: Linux mmd Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the mmd command in Linux, learn how to create Markdown files, and convert them to HTML and PDF formats for various use cases.

meta.title: Linux mmd Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the mmd command in Linux, learn how to create Markdown files, and convert them to HTML and PDF formats for various use cases.
meta.keywords: Linux, mmd command, Markdown, HTML, PDF, file operations, directory management

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the mmd Command

verify.name: Verify the creation of the Markdown file
verify.hint: The `mmd` command should have created a new file named `sample.md` in the `~/project` directory. Please check if the file exists.

steps.title: Create Markdown Files Using the mmd Command

verify.name: Verify the creation of Markdown files
verify.hint: The `mmd` command should have created two new files named `sample.md` and `sample2.md` in the `~/project` directory. Please check if both files exist.

steps.title: Convert Markdown Files to HTML and PDF Formats

verify.name: Verify the creation of HTML and PDF files
verify.hint: The `mmd` command should have created two new files named `sample.html` and `sample.pdf` in the `~/project` directory. Please check if both files exist.
